commitResults.messageTitle: Level-0: Implement skeletal version of Vatican
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename Duke to Vatican and implement a basic greeting and exit
sequence.

Changes:
- Renamed Duke.java to Vatican.java
- Added Vatican ASCII logo
- Updated README.md to remove Duke-related elements

commitResults.messageTitle: Created a new Toronto Slang greeting and implemented an echo loop
Level-1: Echo functionality with Toronto persona
commitResults.messageBody:
Upgraded Vatican from a skeletal greeting to a functional echo bot
that reads and repeats user input.

This update introduces a continuous input loop using the Scanner
class. The application now stays active, processing user strings
until the "bye" command is detected. The chatbot's personality
has been customised with a unique Toronto-inspired greeting and
exit sequence.

Key changes:
- Added java.util.Scanner for real-time console interaction.
- Implemented a while(true) loop for persistent execution.
- Added logic to break the loop specifically on a 'bye' command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-2: Implentation of task storage and display
commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented a storage mechanism to keep track of user inputs and
display them upon request.

This update replaces the simple echo behavior with a task-tracking
system. Users can now build a list of items which are stored in
a fixed-size array. The 'list' command iterates through the
stored items to display them.

Key changes:
- Declared a String array with a capacity of 100 to store tasks.
- Integrated a counter to track the number of active tasks.
- Added logic to differentiate between the 'list' command and
  standard task entry.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implemeted Task class to represent tasks
Created TaskList and Ui classes to encapsulate more functions for Level-3 implementation
Complete implementation of TaskList and Ui
Level-3: Added task completion and OOP refactor
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduced Task, TaskList, and Ui classes to support marking tasks as
done while abstracting application logic.

This update refactors the main method into a modular
structure. The Task class encapsulates completion state, TaskList manages the task
collection, and Ui handles the Vatican persona and console output.
Users can now 'mark' and 'unmark' tasks by their list index.

Key changes:
- Created Task class to track description and isDone status.
- Implemented TaskList to encapsulate array operations.
- Abstracted all console persona and formatting into the Ui class.
- Added logic to display [X] and [ ] status icons in list view.
- Updated Vatican main loop to handle multi-word commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-4: Add Todo, Deadline, and Event subclasses using inheritance
Level-4: Specialised task types and inheritance
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce Todo, Deadline, and Event subclasses and refactor the
command loop to handle multiple task types.

This update applies the A-Inheritance extension, allowing the system
to distinguish between different task behaviors. The TaskList now
utilises some polymorphism to manage a collection of Task objects, while
the UI displays type-specific icons ([T], [D], [E]). Input validation is
still not added so the bot crashes when delimiters (/by, /from, /to)
are missing.

Key changes:
- Created Todo, Deadline, and Event classes inheriting from Task.
- Updated Vatican.java with more new commands witin the switch-case parser.
- Refined TaskList and Ui to handle polymorphic Task objects.

commitResults.messageTitle: Setting up files for TextUi Testing
Level-5: Custom exceptions with Toronto persona
commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented robust error handling using custom exceptions and updated
the chatbot persona with specific error messages.

Key changes:
- Added VaticanException class to handle chatbot-specific errors.
- Refactored Vatican.java to use try-catch blocks for the main loop.
- Added validation for empty descriptions (todo, deadline, event).
- Added validation for invalid indices in mark/unmark to prevent crashes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-6: Support task deletion and ArrayList usage
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement the delete command and refactor task storage from a
primitive array to an ArrayList to support dynamic sizing and
efficient removal.

Key changes:
- Refactored TaskList.java to use ArrayList<Task> (A-Collections).
- Added delete command to Vatican.java with index validation.
- Updated Ui.java with showDeleted() and unified line formatting.
- Maintained Toronto persona for all new success and error messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Enums: Command handling using CommandType enum
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace string-based command parsing with a strongly-typed Enum
approach to improve type safety and maintainability.

Key changes:
- Introduced `CommandType` enum to represent valid user commands.
- Updated `Vatican.java` to parse inputs using `CommandType.fromString()`,
  ensuring case-insensitive matching.
- Refactored the main execution loop by extracting command logic into
  dedicated private helper methods (e.g., `handleTodo`, `handleDelete`).
- Verified regression testing with `text-ui-test`; behavior and output
  remain consistent with previous versions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement toFileFormat in Task and subclasses
Create Storage class for OS-independent file I/O
Level-7: Implement automated task persistence
commitResults.messageBody:
Integrate the Storage class to enable automatic data loading on
startup and persistent saving whenever the task list is modified.

Key changes:
- Created Storage class to handle file I/O using java.nio.file.Path
  for OS-independent path handling.
- Implemented directory creation logic to ensure the "data" folder
  exists before writing vatican.txt.
- Added toFileFormat() across Task subclasses to convert objects
  into a machine-readable piped format.
- Refactored Vatican.java main loop to load existing tasks on
  startup and trigger storage.save() after every valid command.
- Fixed an issue where the scanner required double input to exit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Deadline: Refactor to use LocalDate for date storage
Event: Integrate LocalDate for event duration
Storage: Update task parser for date-aware constructors
Level-8: Implement Java Date and Time API
commitResults.messageBody:
Teach the chatbot to understand and format dates instead of
treating them as raw strings.

Key changes:
- Replaced String-based dates with java.time.LocalDate in
  Deadline and Event classes.
- Standardized input format to yyyy-MM-dd (ISO_LOCAL_DATE).
- Implemented user-friendly output formatting (e.g., Oct 15 2019)
  using DateTimeFormatter.
- Enhanced error handling to catch DateTimeParseException and
  re-throw as persona-consistent VaticanExceptions.
- Verified persistence integrity by ensuring saved dates are
  correctly re-parsed during startup.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-MoreOOP: Define abstract Command and ExitCommand
A-MoreOOP: Implement Parser with basic ExitCommand support
A-MoreOOP: Implement hybrid loop to test Parser and ExitCommand
A-MoreOOP: Migrate LIST logic to ListCommand and Update Parser for LIST
A-MoreOOP: Complete refactor to Command pattern and lean Parser
A-MoreOOP: Final cleanup of Vatican class structure
A-MoreOOP: Refactor Vatican to implement Command
commitResults.messageBody:
This refactor transforms the application from a procedural script into a
fully extensible OOP engine. Logic is now decentralized across specialized
components to adhere to the Single Responsibility Principle.

Technical changes:
- Abstracted user actions into a `Command` hierarchy (Add, Delete, Mark, List, Exit).
- Ported all string parsing and validation logic from Vatican.java to `Parser.java`.
- Updated `Vatican.java` to an instance-based model with a streamlined `run()` loop.
- Ensured `Storage` and `Ui` interactions occur within specific Command executions.
- Verified error handling remains consistent with 'Vatican' persona during migration.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Packages: Move classes into package-appropriate directory structure
A-Packages: Update package headers, explicit imports, and build scripts
vatican.txt end-state updates
vatican.txt saved values update
A-Packages: Refactor into specialised packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Organised classes into a hierarchical package structure to improve
maintainability and follow standard Java development conventions.

Key Changes:
- Grouped core logic and exceptions into the `vatican` root package.
- Segregated all user actions into `vatican.command`.
- Encapsulated task data models into `vatican.task`.
- Moved I/O and state management into `vatican.data`.
- Isolated user interface logic into `vatican.ui`.
- Replaced wildcard imports with explicit imports to maintain code
  clarity and prevent namespace pollution.
- Updated build scripts (runtest.sh/bat) to support the new
  fully qualified class paths.

Verified architectural integrity by running regression tests using the
newly qualified package paths.

A-Gradle: Configure root project name and mainClass for Vatican
A-JUnit: Add unit tests for Parser and Todo classes
Merge branch 'branch-A-JUnit'

Merge branch 'branch-A-Jar'
Level-9: Add description getter and search logic to TaskList
Level-9: Add showFoundTasks method to Ui
Level-9: Implement FindCommand class
Level-9: Enable parsing for 'find' keyword
A-JavaDoc: Add standard documentation to Task subclasses
A-CodingStandard: Implement Intellij Code Style optimisations and update codebase with 'reformat code' to reach coding standard
Merge branch 'branch-A-JavaDoc'
Merge Level-9 into Master: Resolved conflicts between Find feature, JavaDocs, and Coding Standards
Stop tracking local data files and Configure Checkstyle within project
Modify all files within vatican to adhere to CheckStyle requirements
A-CheckStyle: Integrate CheckStyle and Fix Style
commitResults.messageBody:
This merge incorporates the Checkstyle configuration and resolves
formatting issues to align with the module's Java coding standard.

- Add checkstyle.xml and suppressions.xml config files
- Fix MissingJavadoc, ImportOrder, and Newline violations
- Update .gitignore to exclude data/vatican.txt
- Remove data/vatican.txt from Git tracking
